title: The Entertainer (Theme)
arranger: Simplified arrangement of the main theme
source: Public domain — simplified main theme (famous from 'The Sting')

musicalLanguage.description: Scott Joplin's most famous rag, immortalized by the 1973 film 'The Sting'. The main theme features that unforgettable syncopated melody over a steady left-hand stride. This simplified version captures the essential hook — the bouncy, playful character that makes everyone smile.
keyMoments: Bar 1: The iconic pickup and opening — everyone recognizes this instantly
Bars 3-4: The melody leaps up and syncopates — this is the fun part
Bars 7-8: The phrase repeats with a slight variation and resolves
teachingGoals: Syncopated melody over steady bass — hand independence
Grace notes and ornamental playing for character
Ragtime left-hand pattern: bass note on 1-3, chord on 2-4
styleTips: Playful and precise — ragtime is NOT fast. Joplin wrote 'Not Fast' on his scores.
Right hand syncopation should feel cheeky, not rushed

measures.leftHand: C3:q E3:e G3:e C3:q E3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: The famous opening! D-E-C is the pickup that everyone knows. Keep it crisp.

measures.leftHand: C3:q E3:e G3:e C3:q E3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: The melody bounces back down. The charm is in the syncopated rhythm.

measures.leftHand: G2:q B2:e D3:e G2:q B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: Same melody, different bass chord (G). The left hand shift is subtle but important.
Landing on G — a brief moment of repose before the next phrase.

measures.leftHand: F2:q A2:e C3:e F2:q A2:e C3:e
measures.teachingNote: F major in the left hand — the A in the right hand adds a sweet touch.
Descending through the F chord. Keep the left hand stride rock-steady.

measures.leftHand: C3:q E3:e G3:e G2:q B2:e D3:e
measures.fingering: RH: 1-2-5-2-5, LH: C then G stride
measures.teachingNote: The main theme returns for the last time. C to G in the bass sets up the ending.
The big finish — land firmly on C. Not fast! Joplin would approve.
